alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cottle (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:46AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Childress and northeastern Cottle Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 546 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tell, or 5 miles southwest of Childress, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Childress, Tell, and Kirkland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
